name: Achimota School
history: Founded in 1924, one of Ghana’s oldest co-ed senior high schools, known for academic excellence and a long list of prominent alumni.

name: Accra Academy
history: Established in 1931; a leading boys’ high school with strong academics and discipline.

name: Accra High School
history: Founded in 1923; among the oldest public senior high schools in Accra.

name: Presbyterian Boys' Secondary School (PRESEC)
history: Founded in 1938; well-known for excellence in sciences and national academic competitions.

name: Wesley Girls High School (Accra)
history: Girls’ school under Methodist church tradition.

name: Odorgonno Senior High School
history: Day school established in 1940, serving inner-city students.

name: Kaneshie Senior High Technical School
history: Technical-focused public secondary school in Accra.

name: Labone Senior High School
history: Founded in 1949; known for arts and academic programs.

name: Tema Senior High School (TESS)
history: Established 1961; serves Tema–Accra metro area students.

name: Nungua Senior High School
history: Founded 1960; offers general and vocational programs.

name: St. John's Grammar Senior High School
Presbyterian Senior High School, Osu (Osu PRESEC)
history: Day school managed by Presbyterian Church in Osu.

name: Accra Wesley Girls High School
history: Methodist girls’ school focusing on academics and discipline.
